search_results.title: Sunscreen
search_results.lyrics:
Sunscreen Lyrics[Verse 1]
I want someone to remind me to wear sunscreen
And take my vitamins when it slips my mind
I want someone who knows how I like my coffee
And wants to share a bed for more than a night

[Chorus]
But I'm stubborn, selfish, easily jealous at times
I'm hard to love, and I just want someone to try

[Verse 2]
I want someone who knows that I'm not made for mornings
And doesn't scold me for smoking when I drink
I want someone who listens when they've heard the stories
And gives me enough space to breathe
[Chorus]
Cause I'm stubborn, selfish, and easily jealous at times
I'm hard to love, and I just want someone to try
To try

[Verse 3]
I want someone who can ground me when I'm too high
And light up the dark side of my head
I want someone to share my coffee, my sunscreen
My mornings, my stories, and my bed

[Chorus]
Someone stubborn, selfish, and easily jealous would be fine
I won't mind if they're hard to love
I just want someone
To tryYou might also like1Embed

song.title: Sunscreen

search_results.full_title: The Great Divide by Ira Wolf
search_results.title: The Great Divide
search_results.lyrics:
The Great Divide Lyrics[Verse 1]
I wish I could leave my skin behind in this old rented room
Float my way 'cross the great divide and be buried in you
I been lookin' far and wide for what I gotta prove
And puttin' peaks in my rearview

[Verse 2]
Well it's colder here than anyone told me the South could get
And I took to stayin' up real late and smokin' cigarettes
The cheap tobacco burns the way that bridge between us did
And I'm left lookin' at the glowing ends
[Chorus]
But am I too far gone
To be running home?
'Cause I’m longin' tonight
To be somewhere across that great divide

[Verse 3]
I wish I could take the hands of time and turn them in reverse
I'd take back every long goodbye with venom in my words
The only way to bein' found is gettin' lost at first
But all I find are more bridges to burn

[Chorus]
So am I too far gone
To be running home?
'Cause I'm longin' tonight
To be somewhere across that great divide

[Instrumental]
(Oooohhh)

[Verse 4]
Well the highway has way of playin' tricks on tired eyes
I swear that I see you ridin' shotgun late at night
Seems that you're the only thing that never leaves my mind
The only thing worth gettin' right
You might also like[Outro]
So am I too far gone?
'Cause I'm running home
If only in my mind
I am somewhere across that great divideEmbed

search_results.title: Fickle Heart
search_results.lyrics:
Fickle Heart Lyrics[Verse 1]
My heart, my heart, my fickle heart
Longs for sun and lays in the dark
Aims for love and misses the mark
My heart, my heart, my fickle heart

[Verse 2]
My feet, my feet, my tired feet
Have carried my fast and far in retreat
But now I'm kicking myself to sleep
With my feet, my feet, my tired feet
[Verse 3]
My mind, my mind, my restless mind
Is caught on the bridges I've left in flames behind
Every step overthought and analyzed
'Til I lose my mind

[Verse 4]
In the cold sweats underneath the sheets
I was trembling with dreams I hate to dream
You stayed awake, clutching my face, trying to save my teeth
Now I grind them to dust

[Verse 5]
My bones, my bones, my aching bones
Are broken and bruised from your sticks and stones
But your words put the knife in my soul
Leaving just bones, aching bones

[Verse 6]
And my fickle heart doesn't have a home
To rest these bones, aching bones
Now I'm just bones, bonesYou might also likeEmbed

song.embed_content: Read “Fickle Heart” by Ira Wolf on Genius
song.title: Fickle Heart

search_results.full_title: Pictures on a Wall by Ira Wolf
search_results.title: Pictures on a Wall
search_results.lyrics:
Pictures on a Wall Lyrics[Verse 1]
I've climbed the mountains in Montana
Danced in the lights of New Orleans
The boy that ran away with me in San Fransisco stayed with me  Nashville made its way in between

[Verse 2]
Fell in love in Minnesota
And fell apart south of Salt Lake
Colorado calls to me
And Washington’ll always be begging for a piece of me to stay
Maybe some things never change
[Chorus]
But I wanna know how it feels to hang pictures on a wall
Sleep in the same bed at night
I want reasons to stay
I want someone to take up my time and miss me when I go

[Verse 3]
I've swam the beaches on the west coast
And climbed the trees of Carolina
I have felt the city streets of Boston underneath my feet
Heard the sound of subways down the line

[Verse 4]
Walked the lakesides of Wisconsin
And bathed in springs of Idaho
I could use a day or two, or even just an afternoon, gettin' myself lost in Chicago
Maybe I'm homesick for it all

[Chorus]
'Cause I wanna know how it feels to hang pictures on a wall
Sleep in the same bed at night
I want reasons to stay
I want someone to take up my time and miss me when I go
I want a home

[Bridge]
'Cause I have traveled across this country wide
And I feel there must be somethin' more to find
You might also like[Verse 5]
I miss those mountains in Montana
I have wandered long enough to know how good a good thing was
I feel it more the further that I get
So the wheels are pointed west

[Chorus]
'Til I know how it feels to hang pictures on a wall
Sleep in the same bed at night
I want reasons to stay
I want someone to take up my time and miss me when I go

[Outro]
I'll find reasons to stay, and someone to take up my time
And I'm not gonna go
When I get home
I'm goin' homeEmbed

search_results.title: Ruby
search_results.lyrics:
Ruby Lyrics[Verse 1]
Ruby
She was made for going West
Did not protest my wandering ways
Ruby
She was pretty as they come
28 years young and unafraid

[Chorus]
She gave me shelter on the coldest nights
Shaded me on summer days
And I had never known my place before
But that’s what Ruby soon became
[Verse 2]
Ruby
She wasn’t good at going fast
And the patience that I lacked I learned to grow
'Cause Ruby had a way of breakin' down
Leavin’ me out there on the road

[Chorus]
She gave me shelter on the coldest nights
Shaded me on summer days
So as we traveled 'cross the country wide
Ruby set the pace

[Verse 3]
Ruby could be fickle and unfit
Good as I would get at times
Ruby was the closet thing to home
I’ll ever know in this life

[Verse 4]
Ruby
Hit that California sand
And slipped right through my hands eventually
Ruby
I guess I knew it all the time
She was never mine to keep
You might also like[Chorus]
She gave me shelter on the coldest nights
Shaded me on summer days
And nothin’ ever felt like home again
When Ruby went away
And nothin’ ever felt like home since when
Ruby went awayEmbed

song.embed_content: Read “Ruby” by Ira Wolf on Genius
song.title: Ruby

album.full_title: The Closest Thing to Home by Ira Wolf
album.name: The Closest Thing to Home

annotations:
Ruby is the name of Ira’s vehicle, a 1988 VW Vanagon Camper.

It’s spends a lot of her time touring with Ruby.

search_results.full_title: One More Chance by Ira Wolf
search_results.title: One More Chance
search_results.lyrics:
One More Chance Lyrics[Verse 1]
I'm sorry for the things I've said
I never meant to break you the way you broke
In a distance over bridges
I hear you calling out through the smoke
And I hold my breath while you choke

[Verse 2]
I watched the cars crash in slow motion
Didn't look away
Should've seen what was coming, you stopped running
But all I know is I chase
I never learned how to stay
[Chorus]
The truth is I'm no good for you
You probably know it by now
But in case you don’t, or you may be forgot
Give me one more chance and I'll let you down

[Verse 2]
And I hope that you find somebody to love
It's what you deserve
Someone to adore you more than you know
And you know I'm not her
All I can promise is the worst

[Chorus]
The truth is I'm no good for you
You probably know it by now
But in case you don’t or you maybe forgot
Give me one more chance and I'll let you down

[Instrumental]

[Bridge]
And I'll remember you drunk and crying
The time you told me it felt like dying
'Cause you knew that we had only been lying to ourselves
You might also like[Chorus]
The truth is I'm no good for you
And you should know it by now
In case you don’t or you maybe forgot
Give me one more chance and I'll let you downEmbed

search_results.full_title: Can I Stay by Ira Wolf
search_results.title: Can I Stay
search_results.lyrics:
Can I Stay Lyrics[Verse 1]
I'm no good at makin' small talk, but do you mind if I sit down?
Indiana was a long shot and I could use another round

[Verse 2]
I don't mean to be too bold, no it's not at all like me
But when you're makin' your way home, would you like some company?

[Chorus]
'Cause oh-oh-oh I'm tired of sleepin' on my own
And oh-oh-oh I've such a long way to go
And you remind somebody I know
Can I stay with you a while?
[Verse 3]
Whiskey eyelids weigh me down some when a smoke-filled talk comes to a close
And it's these moments where my mind runs from the emptiness of open roads

[Chorus]
And oh-oh-oh I'm tired of sleepin' on my own
Oh-oh-oh I've such a long way to go
And you remind somebody I know
Can I stay with you a while?

[Bridge]
Come tomorrow I'll be gone again, so don't ask me for much
I'm no good at keepin' promises; I promise this is enough

[Chorus]
And oh-oh-oh I'm tired of sleepin' on my own
Oh-oh-oh it's such a goddamn lonely road and I'm sleepin' alone
But you remind somebody I know
Can I stay with you a while?
'Cause you remind me of someplace I called home
Can I stay with you a while?You might also likeEmbed

search_results.full_title: Love Song (For the Apocalypse) by Ira Wolf
search_results.title: Love Song (For the Apocalypse)
search_results.lyrics:
Love Song (For the Apocalypse) Lyrics[Verse 1]
I packed a photo of us from our very first date
You packed the water ‘cause I couldn’t carry the weight
And into the ashes you carved out a heart with our names
I can still picture your smile through the mask on your face

And we keep
Dancing through siren sounds
They drown the crying out
But there’s nothing to cry about
[Chorus]

‘Cause there’s no one that I’d rather watch the world end with

[Verse 2]
We used to joke about how we thought this would go down
Super volcanos and meteors out of the clouds
And we always knew it would end in a nuclear shroud
And we can say “we told you so” but what good is that now?

And I try
To keep on the sunny side
But the suns burning me alive
Guess there’s nowhere better to die

[Chorus]
‘Cause there’s no one that I’d rather watch the world end with
There’s no one that I’d rather watch the world end withYou might also likeEmbed

search_results.title: Some Days
search_results.lyrics:
Some Days Lyrics[Verse 1]
Some days are good, some years are not
Knuckles on wood, nerves up in knots
Karma keeps me cautious and bourbon keeps me brave
And just a little too honest to believe that I am saved

[Chorus]
But I am still new at getting old
Pay these dues and wear down these bones
Breakin' is easy and hope is hard
And some days are good and some years aren't
[Verse 2]
Some people change, some things don't
When life's a stage it's all mirrors and smoke
And everyone's a friend 'til the hard times come around
But what I've learned I learned the way no one tells you about

[Chorus]
'Cause I am still new at getting old
I pay these dues and wear down these bones
Breakin' is easy and hope is hard
'Cause some days are good and some years aren't

[Chorus]
I am still new at getting old
I've paid these dues, I've worn out these bones
Breakin' is easy, hope is hard
Some days are good and some years aren't
Some days are good and some years aren't
But some days are goodYou might also likeEmbed

search_results.full_title: Skin and Script by Ira Wolf
search_results.title: Skin and Script
search_results.lyrics:
Skin and Script Lyrics[Verse 1]
All you are is black ink on blue lines
But all I am is one notch in a bedpost
Or at most the ghost that keeps you warm
Just the ghost

[Verse 2]
We went searching for some comfort by using one another
Both needing lovers of some sort, but it was vile and it was cheap
And we trade for what we need with words and curves behind closed doors
[Chorus]
I bought the lines I needed from you
Slippin' out of that dress and my high heel shoes
I guess I needed my fix too
I spent the nights, oh, you spent your words
And we both got hooked, we both got burned
'Cause I move the way that you like
And you fed me your best lines
And we took one more hit of skin and script

[Verse 3]
You lose me in your sleep tucked beneath the same sheets that shelter my bare skin
And I lose my mind when I rewind every time I tasted your sweat I breathed your heat in
'Cause the only way you keep me warm now is burning lyrics I wrote down

[Chorus]
And I bought the lines I needed from you
Slippin' out of that dress and my high heel shoes
I guess I needed my fix too
I spent the night and smoked your words
'Til we both got high, we all got worse
'Cause I love you like you needed
And you became my addiction
Sweet and sick
With one more hit of skin and scriptYou might also likeEmbed
